definition: not harmful or offensive
example: it was an innocuous question

definition: the state of being scarce or in short supply; shortage.
example: the growing scarcity of resources

definition: (especially of sound, taste, and color) pleasantly smooth or soft; free from harshness.
example: she was hypnotized by the mellow tone of his voice

definition: speak or write about in an abusively disparaging manner. /oczerniać
example: he has been vilified in the press

definition: comfort or consolation in a time of distress or sadness.
example: she sought solace in her religion

definition: twice as great or as numerous.
example: a twofold increase in the risk

definition: able to be discerned; perceptible.
example: the scandal had no discernible effect on his career

definition: a hidden or unsuspected danger or difficulty.
example: He bought some books on self-publishing and brushed up on the perils and pitfalls involved

definition: a state of great disturbance, confusion, or uncertainty.
example: the country was in turmoil

definition: showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise./skrupulatny
example: he had always been so meticulous about his appearance

definition: fail to resist (pressure, temptation, or some other negative force).
example: he has become the latest to succumb to the strain

definition: an authoritative warning or order.
example: Commands and injunctions , as I suggested, punctuate the text from the outset.

definition: lacking physical strength, especially as a result of age or illness.
example: my legs are very feeble after the flu

definition: (of an argument or statement) seeming reasonable or probable.
example: a plausible explanation

definition: superficially plausible, but actually wrong.
example: a specious argument

definition: respect and admiration, typically for a person./ respect and admire
example: many of these qualities are esteemed by managers

definition: a short journey undertaken in order to deliver or collect something, often on someone else's behalf.
example: she asked Tim to run an errand for her

definition: refusing to be persuaded or to change one's mind.
example: he is adamant that he is not going to resign

definition: take part in an activity in a casual or superficial way.
example: he dabbled in writing as a young man

definition: having a strong dislike of or opposition to something.
example: as a former CIA director, he is not averse to secrecy

definition: higher/lower in rank, status, or quality.
example: obeying their superiors' orders

definition: trzustka
example: pancreatic

definition: a person's closest living relative or relatives.
example: The driver's name was being withheld until police could notify next of kin .

definition: a natural ability to do something.
example: she had a remarkable aptitude for learning words

definition: very complicated or detailed.
example: an intricate network of canals

definition: exceed/ be greater than
example: levels of production were surpassed in 1253

definition: difficult to find, catch, or achieve.
example: success will become ever more elusive

definition: make (someone) troubled or nervous. / feeling or appearing troubled or nervous.
example: the thought of questioning Toby agitated him extremely

definition: having or showing a keen interest in or enthusiasm for something.
example: an avid reader of science fiction

definition: a difference or contrast between similar things or people./ excellence that sets someone or something apart from others.
example: there is a sharp distinction between domestic politics and international politics/ a novelist of distinction

definition: well meaning and kindly./ having or showing a wish to do evil to others.
example: a benevolent smile/ the glint of dark, malevolent eyes

definition: very generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival or someone less powerful than oneself./ wspaniałomyślny
example: More importantly, the ode implies that Henri is generous and magnanimous

definition: to exist only in small numbers or amounts
hopeful side of a situation that might seem gloomy on the surface. / bright side
example: Ginny: So then I thought, I'd like you to have something to remember me by, you know, if you meet some veela when you're off doing whatever you're doing. Harry: I think dating opportunities are going to be pretty thin on the ground, to be honest. Ginny: There's the silver lining I've been looking for.

definition: stronniczy
example: survivorship bias <- cool effect, recommended to google

definition: (especially of an argument, story, or sentence) extremely complex and difficult to follow.
example: its convoluted narrative encompasses all manner of digressions

definition: too great or extreme to be expressed or described in words.
example: the ineffable natural beauty of the Everglades

definition: obwód
reluctant; unwilling.
example: I was loath to leave

definition: feel intense dislike or disgust for.
example: she loathed him on sight

definition: having a good reputation; admired or respected by others. /dobrze przemyślane
example: he was very well-thought-of within the club

definition: completely and without qualification; absolutely.
example: he looked utterly ridiculous/ to devote yourself utterly to a set of moral principles

definition: niejasny/ niezrozumiały
example: And  though it may be obscure to me

definition: humble submission and respect.
example: he addressed her with the deference due to age

definition: a cunning plan or action designed to turn a situation to one's own advantage. / taktyka
example: That's a cheap ploy - Frank Underwood

definition: acting with or showing care and thought for the future.
example: no prudent money manager would authorize a loan without first knowing its purpose

definition: mięso/roślino/wszystko-żerny
Used when talking about whether something is easily the best.
skrzele/ the paired respiratory organ of fishes and some amphibians, by which oxygen is extracted from water flowing over surfaces within or attached to the walls of the pharynx.
example: in addition to extracting oxygen from the water with their gills

definition: not even or regular in pattern or movement; unpredictable. /niekonsekwentny,nieregularny
example: He still has this erratic speech pattern, the fluttering of the eyes, and he's the most appalling speechmaker.

definition: to get first-time experience with someting
make superficially attractive or acceptable.
example: you won't see him sugar-coat the truth

definition: bystry
to linger/ marudzić, ale w znaczeniu, że tak tracić czas
example: workers were loafing, dallying, or goofing off
